snippet: New York's public-school teachers may not contact students through personal pages on Web sites like Facebook and Twitter, but can communicate through pages set up for classroom use, reports David W. Chen and Patrick McGeehan in Wednesday's New York...
abstract: New York's public-school teachers may not contact students through personal pages on Web sites like Facebook and Twitter, but can communicate through pages set up for classroom use, reports David W. Chen and Patrick McGeehan in Wednesday's New York Times, according to new rules by the city's Education Department.

headline.main: Daily Report: New York City Sets Social Media Rules for Teachers
